titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph W. and Kit Reed Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday May 3, 2019 at 03:01

did.unittitle: Joseph W. and Kit Reed Papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Joseph W. and Kit Reed Papers contain correpondence, writings by Joseph and Kit Reed and others, notes and research papers, personal and professional papers, financial papers, photographs, artwork, printed material, audiocassettes and videocassettes, scrapbooks, and computer disks. The papers document their personal and professional lives and artistic endeavors.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
This collection has multiple call numbers. To page materials, please submit the Uncat call number for the appropriate acquisition along with the desired box number.
Box 169 (audiovisual material): Restricted Fragile. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 170 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Joseph W. and Kit Reed Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joseph W. and Kit Reed Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into twenty-seven groupings: Early Acquisitions, 1950-1987; 1984 Acquisitions, 1942-1984; 1985 Acquisitions, 1960-1985; 1986 Acquisitions, 1982-1987; 1987 Acquisitions, 1950-1987; 1988 Acquisitions, 1951-1988; 1989 Acquisitions, 1936-1989; 1990 Acquisitions, 1972-1990; 1991 Acquisitions, 1932-1991; 1992 Acquisitions, 1933-1992; 1993 Acquisitions, 1940-1993; 1994 Acquisitions, 1976-1994; 1995 Acquisitions, 1969-1995; 1996 Acquisitions, 1992-1996; 1997 Acquisitions, 1992-1998; 1998 Acquisitions, 1977-1998; 1999 Acquisitions, 1962-1999; 2000 Acquisitions, 1995-2000; 2001 Acquisitions, 1944-2001; 2002 Acquisitions, 1999-2002; 2003 Acquisitions, 1992-2002; 2004 Acquisitions, 1957-2004; 2005 Acquisitions, 1927-2005; 2006 Acquisitions, 2002-2006; 2007 Acquisitions, 1985-2007; 2008 Acquisitions, 1995-2008; and 2009-2014 Acquisitions, 1968-2014.

Material within this collection has been organized by acquisition reflecting the fact that the collection has been acquired in increments over time. Researchers should note that material within each acquisition overlaps with/or relates to material found in other acquisitions. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers will need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section.
Researchers should also note that similar material can be arranged differently in each acquisition, depending on how the material was organized when it was received by the library.

bioghist.head: Kit Reed (1932-)
bioghist.p: Kit Reed, American author of fiction, including under the pseudonyms Kit Craig and Shelley Hyde. Reed was born Lillian Craig on June 7, 1932 in San Diego, California. She married Joseph Reed, Jr. in 1955. She is Resident Writer at Wesleyan University.

bioghist.head: Joseph W. Reed (1932-)
bioghist.p: Joseph W. Reed, American author and artist. Reed was born on May 31, 1932 in St. Petersburg, Florida. He is a graduate of Yale University (B.A. 1954; M.A. 1958; PhD. 1961) and Professor Emeritus of English and American Studies at Wesleyan University. He married Kit Reed in 1955.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired by gift and purchase, 1940-2014. Unless otherwise noted, acquisitions were a gift of Joseph and Kit Reed.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, identified by a unique call number and titled according to month and year of acquisition.

The finding aid for this collection is compiled from individual preliminary lists for each acquisition that were created at or around the time of receipt by the library. The preliminary lists were migrated to comply with current archival descriptive standards and merged into a single file in 2007-2008. As part of the migration, modifications were made to the formatting of individual lists; however, the content of the lists was neither modified nor verified.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

July 2006 Acquisition (Uncat ZA File 705) was not located when the collection was processed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Joseph W. and Kit Reed Papers contain correpondence, writings by Joseph and Kit Reed and others, notes and research papers, personal and professional papers, financial papers, photographs, artwork, printed material, audiocassettes and videocassettes, scrapbooks, and computer disks. The papers document their personal and professional lives and artistic endeavors.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Joseph W. Reed Designs and Art Work Collection (AOB 5). Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Correspondence and clippings relating to Joseph and Kit Reed
1. Pencil portrait of man with moustache. 8x10". Captioned, signed and dated
2. Pencil portrait of man with moustache (rear view). 8x10". Signed and captioned "second."
3. Pencil portrait of "Eminent Doctor of Medicine who Feels no Further Need to Keep up with the Literature." 8x10". Signed, with ink manuscript notes on verso
4. Watercolor of tree against southwestern landscape. 8x10". Unsigned, but with two pencil portraits, of Henry IV of France and Rothschild, on verso, signed
5. Pencil portrait of woman. 8x10". Signed, captioned "3rd"
6. Printed reproduction of PH drawing of foil for use as cover of THE MAVERICK . Signed in ink "Paul"
7. Ink drawing, 8x10." Signed and dated. Entitled "Small Craft Warning"
8. Christmas card from Dwight H. H. Starr, reproducing PH drawing. Matted, 4x6"
9. Proof impression of title-page for FOLK-SAY IV , University of Oklahoma Press. Reproduces a drawing by Paul Horgan
10. Ink portrait of William Shakespeare, 12x9 1/2". Signed

11. Ink and watercolor drawing of "The Princess," 10 1/2 x 6 1/2". Matted. An illustration for an unpublished novel, THE GREY SWANS , signed. With ms. explanatory caption on verso of mount, signed in full by Paul Horgan
12. Ink caricature of Hugh Walpole, 8x5". Signed in full. Matted
13. Untitled pencil portrait of a fashionable woman, 12x9". Mounted. Signed in full on drawing, and again on mount. With attached tissue overleaf, with typed caption, signed in full by Paul Horgan
14. STAGE FOLK . Suite of four watercolor portraits, with captions, and manuscript cover sheet, signed, 9x10 1/2"
15. Stylized pencil portrait of a woman. 8 1/2 x 11". Signed
16. Block print of western landscape. Image size 6x4". Signed and captioned on the border
17. Ink and watercolor portrait of woman at "French Ambassador's Party." 6 x 8 1/2". 1954. Signed, with pencil caption on verso
18. Series of eight pencil portraits, 3x3", each signed and captioned
19. Pencil portrait of a Bishop. 5 1/2 x 4 1/4". Signed
20. Etching of a landscape. 2 1/2 x 3 5/8". Signed on the border
21. Series of seven ink caricatures, entitled "Left Hand Drawings." 6x4". Signed
22. Folded card, with cover illustration after a woodcut by Horgan. 3x4". Signed in pencil
23. Bookplate, after a design by Paul Horgan. 3 1/2 x 2
24. Original ink design for a bookplate for Robert Hunt. 7 1/2 x 5 1/2. Signed
25. Ink portrait of "LAmiral Jean-Marie de la Navire d'Or 1604." 5 1/2 by 3 3/8". With smaller ink portrait on verso
26. Bookplate of Edward Nicholas, printed after a design by Paul Horgan
27. Ink drawing of Rolls Royce and figures, signed, with manuscript captions. 5x7"
28. Watercolor and wash, "Anatomy of a Tugboat." 4 3/4 x 6 1/2". Signed. Matted, with manuscript caption on verso
29. "A Tense Moment at the Middle Comb Derby." Ink drawing with long manuscript caption. 11 x 7 1/2." Matted. Signed and captioned on verso
30. Stylized pencil portrait of a woman. 8 1/2 x 11". Signed
31. Suite of eight proof impressions of illustrations by Peter Hurd for Paul Horgan's HABIT OF EMPIRE , printed by Meriden Gravure. In folder captioned in manuscript by Paul Horgan
